_exec_summary.SummaryText: ICS Logistics is dedicated to providing a safe enviroment to its employees and to the public areas surrounding its Facility. ICS Logistics provides training for all its employees and has provided provisions for alerting the public in case of a accidental release. ICS logistics has provided Worst Case as well as Alternate Case scenerios in order to prepare for any unforeseen accidents that might occur within the Refrigeration System. There is an ammonia alarm system installed that is monitered 24hrs a day, 7 days a week by an outside contractor in order to provide immediate response to any release large or small. This Facility's refrigeration maintenance team has training in Hazardous Response and will work in conjunction with the Jacksonville Fire Department when responding to an emergency. The Jacksonville Fire Department has a fully trained and equipped Hazmat Team on call around the clock. All refrigeration equipment is included in a preventative maintenance program and all maintenance is performed by our inhouse refrigeration technicians. ICS Logistics has a Process Safety Management in place and is up to date on all PHA analysis and Compliance audits. The ultimate goal of ICS Logistics is to provide a safe and accident free workplace. In order to achieve this goal, ICS Logistics will be providing annual operator refresher training, hazardous materials technician and incident commander training, refrigeration system process safety audits, employee awareness, predictive maintenance on all refrigeration equipment, as well as updating all processes involved in the safe upkeep of the Refrigeration process.
